item.title: Fix 'XDG_RUNTIME_DIR not set' error when runnning Wireshark as root
item.description: In case you encounter error like the one below, when trying to run Wireshark as root (e.g.: on Fedora 27, Gnome 3.26 & Wayland): $ sudo wireshark QStandardPaths: XDG_RUNTIME_DIR not set, defaulting to '/tmp/runtime-root' No protocol specified qt.qpa.screen: QXcbConnection: Could not connect to display :0 Could not connect to any X display. Then to fix this, you need to add root user to the list of users allowed to connect oth X11 server:
